meanings.definition: To attract or tempt by offering pleasure or advantage.
meanings.sent1: The colorful candies enticed the children at the party.
meanings.sent2: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies enticed me to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise gift enticed her to finish her chores quickly.
meanings.sent4: The promise of a new adventure enticed him like a shiny treasure.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to learn a new skill enticed the students to sign up for the class.

meanings.definition: To lead on by exciting hope or desire.
meanings.sent1: The exciting movie trailer enticed the audience to watch the film.
meanings.sent2: The intriguing book cover enticed me to read the first chapter.
meanings.sent3: The thought of a weekend getaway enticed them to plan their trip.
meanings.sent4: The dream of success enticed her to work hard every day.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked bread enticed the neighbors to visit the bakery.
